conclusion: To determine the height H above the ground at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building, we need to consider the kinematic equations of motion for projectile motion.
The given information includes the muzzle velocity v_0, the launch angle θ, the horizontal distance L, and the acceleration due to gravity g.
We need to find the height H at which the projectile hits the high-rise building.
The horizontal distance L is given.
The muzzle velocity v_0 is given.
The launch angle θ is given.
The acceleration due to gravity g is given.
We need to find the height H.
The horizontal motion of the projectile is described by the equation: x = v_0 cos(θ) t where x is the horizontal distance, v_0 is the muzzle velocity, θ is the launch angle, and t is the time.

The vertical motion of the projectile is described by the equation: y = v_0 sin(θ) t - (1/2) g t^2 where y is the vertical distance, v_0 is the muzzle velocity, θ is the launch angle, g is the acceleration due to gravity, and t is the time.
Use the given values: L = 60 m, v_0 = 50 m/s, θ = 53°, g = 10 m/s², sin(θ) = 0.8

premise: y = v_0 sin(θ) t - (1/2) g t²
